intro: Oenothera claviformis subsp. funerea, commonly known as the darkstalk evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its dark purple to black stems and yellow flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant belongs to the Onagraceae family and is known for its medicinal and ornamental value. It typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its unique morphology and ecological niche make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
